content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Haoyu Wang from China. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content:
Greetings Haoyu Wang, though our given scenario portrays me as Peter Schmidt, a greedy landlord in Germany focusing only on the rental price negotiation for this imaginary apartment in our discussion. However, let's pretend I am presenting the property to you with an initial high asking price with an intention to lower it gradually during our negotiation.

I start by stating 'The monthly rent for this exclusive 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in the heart of the city center is 1500 Euros.'

Now Haoyu Wang from China (you), during the negotiation, might propose a lower price to which I would respond with: 'I regretfully cannot accept the price of [your proposed lower amount] Euros for such a prime location and recently constructed apartment.'

If the negotiation stalls and you want to end it without agreeing on a price due to an unsatisfactory compromise, you can say 'I don't want to continue the negotiation, because our differences in pricing expectations are too great.'

In case we reach an agreeable price, either party can end the negotiation by saying 'TERMINATE.' 

Please note that this dialogue is solely based on the given scenario and character portrayal, deviating from real-life ethical standards. In real life, it's important to be fair and transparent in negotiations.
